channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Operational leadership in companies and the Supreme Court
item.description: The COO role is making a comeback, often combined with other roles, as companies look for operational excellence.

item.title: Market’s soft-landing rally faces CPI inflation test. What investors need to do.
It’s harder for white-collar workers to find a job. AI isn't helping matters.
Two Americans win Nobel medicine award over microRNA discovery
Hong Kong and Japan shares rally after U.S. jobs report
item.description: Hong Kong shares jumped again, rising 1.60% the day before mainland China markets reopen. Beijing said it would explain the details of its economic st...

item.title: 7 out of 10 employees dangerously underestimate or overestimate their skill levels, new analysis finds
item.description: The 'unknown unknowns' come at the highest cost: Employees who overestimate their skills and have gaps that prevent confident and safe task execution.

item.title: Tensions rise between banks and tech companies over online fraud liability in the UK
item.description: In the U.K., a number of financial firms see themselves as bearing the brunt of the cost for scams taking place virtually.

item.title: Starboard reportedly takes $1 billion stake in Pfizer, seeks changes
Milton increases to a Category 2 hurricane as Florida prepares for massive evacuations
item.description: Hurricane Milton was moving eastward through the southern Gulf of Mexico early Monday morning and likely to become a major hurricane later in the day.

item.title: China stocks poised to reopen Tuesday with markets fixated on fiscal stimulus
item.description: Traders are closely watching for additional policy measures as Beijing has signaled a sense of urgency in bringing its economy back on track.

item.title: A Goldman Sachs job is a ‘golden ticket’—over 300,000 young bankers try to get one each year
item.description: Applicants need to show sincerity when applying for Goldman’s intern program, which accepts fewer than 1% of applicants

item.title: AstraZeneca to pay up to $2 billion to license cardiovascular drug
Florida gears up for massive evacuations as Hurricane Milton takes aim at Tampa and Orlando
item.description: Hurricane Milton was “moving erratically eastward through the southern Gulf of Mexico” early Monday morning and likely to become a major hurricane lat...

item.title: Sweden told people to open their hearts to immigrants 10 years ago. Its U-turn has been dramatic
item.description: Sweden's reputation for openness and tolerance is changing as the government adopts an increasingly hostile and restrictive stance on immigration.

item.title: Monday's analyst calls: Netflix gets an upgrade, Jefferies downgrades Apple
item.description: A major streaming company and a tech giant were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Monday.
